item.description:
Hi Everyone -

It's been a long time (almost a year in fact!) since we hiked here.  A couple of trails that I have never tried so we'll do a bit of exploring this time in addition to our usual route. 

From there we will go to our favorite restaurant, Village Pancake House in Rowley, about a 15 minute drive from the sanctuary.

Here is the link and directions to the Sanctuary:

http://www.massaudubon.org/Nature_Connection/Sanctuaries/Ipswich_River/index.php

...and the link to the restaurant and menu:

http://villagepancakehouse.com/

Great pancakes and turkey dinners - just to name two of their famous menu items!

We'll hike from 10:30 to around 1:00 - 1:30 - estimate 4 - 5 miles - and then head out for lunch.  Please be sure you can join us for both the hike and lunch, as I make reservations if more than eight sign up.

The Audubon Society charges a $4 fee for non-members (in addition to the standard $1 Meetup fee).

As of now, no snow - but wear non-skid soles for occasional icy patches.

Bring bird seeds for the hungry birds at this time of year if you would like to do so!  The chickadees, titmice, and nuthatches will eat out of your hand at this time of year, if the ground is frozen and most especially if there is snow!   Due to the presence of birds and other wildlife, the Sanctuary does not allow dogs; sorry.

Randy
item.how_to_find_us: Look for the silver Subaru Forester in the lot; see my photo on the site in case there are multiple Subaru Foresters - lol!

group.name: North Shore Not Too Intense Hikers

item.name: Hike at Ipswich River Wildlife Sanctuary and lunch
